snippet: When U2 and Apple forcibly gave away the band’s latest album, it was a misstep for a group that has fought to avoid fading into the background of the pop culture landscape.
abstract: David Carr The Media Equation column posits that when U2 and Apple forcibly gave away the band’s latest album on iTunes, it was the first significant misstep for a group that has consistently fought to avoid fading into the background of the pop culture landscape; says in this time and place, music is meant to be pulled by consumers, not pushed on them by big rock music acts and an even bigger company.
lead_paragraph: When U2 and Apple forcibly gave away the band’s latest album, it was a misstep for a group that has fought to avoid fading into the background of the pop culture landscape.

headline.seo: For Bono and U2, Apple iTunes Partnership Finally Hits a Wrong Note
headline.main: Chasing Relevancy at Any Cost, Even Free
headline.print_headline: Chasing Relevancy at Any Cost, Even Free
